instruction: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
Grease and flour two nine-inch round pans.
In a large bowl, stir together the sugar, flour, cocoa, baking powder, baking soda, and salt.
Add the eggs, milk, oil, and vanilla, and mix for 2 minutes on medium speed of mixer.
Stir in the boiling water last. Batter will be thin. Pour evenly into the prepared pans.
Bake 30 to 35 minutes in the preheated oven, until the cake tests done with a toothpick.
Cool in the pans for 10 minutes, then remove to a wire rack to cool completely.
Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. Add spaghetti and cook for 8 to 10 minutes or until al dente; drain.
In a medium bowl, whisk together eggs and Parmesan cheese.
Heat a large skillet over medium heat. Add pancetta and cook until crisp, about 5 minutes.
Add garlic to the skillet and cook for 1 minute.
Remove the skillet from heat and add the hot, drained spaghetti.
Quickly pour in the egg and cheese mixture, tossing to coat the spaghetti.
Season with salt and pepper to taste and serve immediately.
Heat oil in a large pot over medium heat.
Add onions and cook until soft and translucent, about 5 minutes.
Add garlic, ginger, and spices, and cook for another 2 minutes.
Add chicken pieces and cook until lightly browned, about 5 minutes.
Stir in tomatoes and coconut milk.
Bring to a simmer, then reduce heat to low and cook for 30 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Season with salt and pepper to taste and serve with rice.
Heat oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
Add garlic and cook for 1 minute.
Add vegetables and cook, stirring frequently, until tender, about 5-7 minutes.
Stir in soy sauce and cook for another 1-2 minutes.
Serve over rice or noodles.
